importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication marks the announcement of Pakistan's successful launch of its first hyperspectral satellite, a major milestone in the country's space program.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The launch of Pakistan's H1 hyperspectral satellite occurred in 2025, placing it within a broader context of national technological advancement and strategic space program development.

keyTakeAways: Pakistan has launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, marking a major milestone in its space capabilities.
The satellite was launched successfully from China’s Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre on October 19, 2025.
H1 is a hyperspectral satellite capable of detecting subtle chemical or material changes on Earth’s surface, which traditional satellites cannot.
The satellite will support national objectives in agriculture, environmental monitoring, urban planning, and disaster management.
SUPARCO (Pakistan’s space agency) stated that the data from H1 will enhance precision agriculture, climate resilience, and natural resource management.
Pakistan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs highlighted the satellite’s role in strengthening the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) by improving geohazard risk assessment.
The launch reflects Pakistan’s growing strategic partnership with China in peaceful space exploration and technology cooperation.
Pakistan has launched three satellites this year: H1 (hyperspectral), EO-1, and KS-1, with the latter two already fully operational.
It may take approximately two months to calibrate the H1 satellite before it becomes fully operational.
This mission is part of Pakistan’s broader push to expand its space program and technological self-reliance.

namedEntities.name: Pakistan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Pakistan is the nation launching its first hyperspectral satellite, marking a significant step in its space program and technological development.

namedEntities.name: SUPARCO
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: SUPARCO is responsible for the launch and management of Pakistan’s hyperspectral satellite H1, making it central to the article’s narrative on national space progress.

namedEntities.name: H1 satellite
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite is the centerpiece of the article, representing a technological breakthrough with applications in agriculture, disaster response, and environmental monitoring.

namedEntities.name: Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A space launch facility in China.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite was launched from this center in China, highlighting international collaboration and Pakistan’s reliance on foreign launch infrastructure.

namedEntities.name: China
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: China hosts the launch site for Pakistan’s H1 satellite, reflecting a strategic partnership between the two nations in space technology and development.

namedEntities.name: China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major infrastructure development linking Xinjiang (China) to Gwadar Port (Pakistan).
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite’s ability to assess geohazards supports CPEC’s development goals by improving risk mitigation in infrastructure projects.

namedEntities.name: Precision agriculture
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A method of farming using data and technology to optimize crop yields.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: H1’s hyperspectral data will enable more precise and efficient agricultural practices, contributing to food security and productivity.

namedEntities.name: Environmental monitoring
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The systematic observation and analysis of environmental conditions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The satellite will be used to monitor environmental changes such as water resources and land degradation.

namedEntities.name: Disaster management
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The response to natural disasters such as floods or earthquakes.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: H1 can detect early signs of natural disasters, improving early warning systems and response planning.

namedEntities.name: Urban planning
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The design and development of cities and towns.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The satellite data will support more informed and sustainable urban development decisions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Pakistan has successfully launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, from China’s Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre, marking a pivotal achievement in its national space program. The satellite, developed by SUPARCO, is designed to detect subtle changes in Earth’s surface materials, enabling applications in agriculture, environmental monitoring, urban planning, and disaster management. The launch reflects deepening cooperation between Pakistan and China, with potential benefits to initiatives like the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC). While the satellite is expected to be fully operational within about two months, two other satellites (EO-1 and KS-1) are already in orbit and functioning. This mission underscores Pakistan’s growing ambitions in space technology and its efforts to enhance national resilience and development through scientific innovation.
title: Pakistan launches its first hyperspectral satellite
